name: Briggs, Donald T. Jr.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Donald T. Briggs Jr. as a Bohemian Grove T-N-T camp member. Multiple individuals with similar names exist in California but none confirmed as this individual.

name: Burrow, Peter N.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Peter N. Burrow. A Peter Burrows (different spelling) is a technology journalist with 22 years at BusinessWeek and Bloomberg News covering Apple, Cisco, HP, and Microsoft, now a freelancer based in Alameda, California. Identity as T-N-T camp member unconfirmed.

name: Collins, Arthur R.
title: Founding and Managing Partner
political_donations: Senior Political Strategist for Obama 2008 presidential campaign; Senior advisor to Senator John Kerry 2004 presidential campaign. Affiliated with Democratic Party.
ngos: Brookings Institution (Vice Chair, Board of Trustees); Morehouse School of Medicine (Chairman, Board of Trustees); RLJ Lodging Trust (director); Meridian International Center (trustee); Congressional Black Caucus Political Education and Leadership Institute (board); Florida A&M University (former chairman, board of trustees)
notes: Arthur R. Collins (born March 16, 1960) is Founding and Managing Partner of theGROUP DC LLC, a strategy, policy, and communications consulting firm established in 2011. Previously was Chairman and CEO of Public Private Partnership, Inc. (founded 1989). Holds BS in Accounting (1982) and honorary DHL (2009) from Florida A&M University. Began career as engineer and account marketing representative at IBM Corporation. Was appointed to Florida A&M University Board of Trustees by Governor Jeb Bush in 2001, serving as its first chairman. Also a director of KB Home (NYSE: KBH), elected to that board in 2020.

name: Dagley, William F.
title: President and CEO
ngos: Dominican University of California (Board of Trustees, 13 years); Teller Wildlife Refuge, Montana (Chairman, Board of Trustees)
notes: William F. Dagley is President and CEO of Private Wealth Partners LLC, a Larkspur, California-based wealth management firm. He has approximately 40 years of industry experience. Prior roles include institutional trading at Hambrecht & Quist and membership on the Pacific Options Exchange (1984-1994). Holds BA and MBA from UC Berkeley.

name: Foster, Paul S. III
employer: EAH Housing (board); formerly Bank of California / Union Bank and WestAmerica Bank
title: Board Member (EAH Housing); formerly Senior Vice President
ngos: EAH Housing (Board of Directors since July 1990; Executive and Audit committees)
notes: Paul S. Foster has over 20 years of experience in commercial banking, including serving as Senior Vice President at The Bank of California (now Union Bank) and Senior Vice President at WestAmerica Bank. He has been a board member of EAH Housing, a nonprofit affordable housing developer based in San Rafael, California, since July 1990, serving on the Executive and Audit (Chair) committees.

name: Goss, Thomas A.
title: Managing Partner / Chairman
ngos: National Parks Foundation (National Council and Board of Directors)
notes: Thomas A. Goss (born July 6, 1946, Knoxville, Tennessee) graduated from the University of Michigan in 1968 and was named All-Big Ten defensive tackle. He rose through executive ranks at Procter & Gamble, R.J. Reynolds, Del Monte, and Faygo Beverages. In March 1997, he established The Goss Group, Inc., a commercial insurance brokerage firm, and concurrently served as the first African American Athletic Director at the University of Michigan (1997-2000) before resigning amid controversy. In 2001, The Goss Group, Marsh Inc., and GMAC Insurance Group formed Goss LLC, where he served as Chairman.

name: Harvey, Robert A. MD
employer: Private practice; Saint Francis Memorial Hospital; California Pacific Medical Center
title: Board-Certified Plastic Surgeon; former President/Chief of Staff (Saint Francis Memorial Hospital)
notes: Dr. Robert A. Harvey, MD, MBA, FACS is a board-certified plastic surgeon in San Francisco, California, with a practice at 1199 Bush Street. He graduated from Indiana University School of Medicine in 1972 and studied at The London Hospital, University of London. He completed his plastic surgery residency as Chief Resident at New York Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center. He earned an MBA from the University of San Francisco and holds Certified Physician Executive (CPE) designation. At Saint Francis Memorial Hospital he has served as Chief of Staff, Chairman of the Department of Surgery, and Chairman of the Department of Plastic Surgery.

name: Jackson, David P.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying David P. Jackson as a Bohemian Grove T-N-T camp member. Multiple individuals with this name exist in California and finance/investment sectors.

name: Keller, Mark Stephen
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Mark Stephen Keller as a Bohemian Grove T-N-T camp member. Multiple executives named Mark Keller exist in California.

name: Kenna, Lee M. Jr.
title: Chairman of the Board and CEO
notes: Lee M. Kenna Jr. is Chairman and CEO of SIMCO Electronics, a calibration and software services company for test and measurement instruments headquartered in Santa Clara, California (founded 1962). He holds a degree from Duke University and attended Harvard Business School. He is based in Sunnyvale, California.

name: Lockhart, James B.
employer: Bipartisan Policy Center; Bruce Museum, Greenwich, Connecticut
title: Senior Fellow; Chairman
ngos: Bipartisan Policy Center (Senior Fellow; Co-Chair, Commission on Retirement Security and Personal Savings); Bruce Museum, Greenwich CT (Chairman, elected June 2019)
notes: James B. Lockhart III (born 1946) holds a BA from Yale University (1968) and an MBA from Harvard Business School (1974). He served as a Lieutenant (j.g.) in the U.S. Navy on a nuclear ballistic missile submarine. Government service includes: Executive Director/CEO of the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation under President George H.W. Bush (1989-1993); Deputy Commissioner and COO of the Social Security Administration (2002-2006); and Director of OFHEO and then the first Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency (2006-2009), overseeing the conservatorship of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac in September 2008. He subsequently served as Vice Chairman of WL Ross & Co. (2009-2018).

name: Lundy, Gordon Collins
employer: Gordon C. Lundy, MD, A Professional Corporation
title: Orthopedic Surgeon
ngos: LeRoy C. Abbott Orthopaedic Society at UCSF (President)
notes: Dr. Gordon Collins Lundy, MD is a Board Certified Orthopedic Surgeon and Sports Medicine Specialist practicing in San Francisco, California at 2100 Webster Street, Suite 117. He holds a BA in Physiology and Cell Biology from UC Santa Barbara (1980) and graduated from UCSF School of Medicine in 1985. He completed his internship and residency at UCSF. Board certified by the American Board of Orthopaedic Surgery (1993, recertified 2014). He is affiliated with California Pacific Medical Center and Brown & Toland Physicians.

name: Majewski, Steven R.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Steven R. Majewski as a Bohemian Grove T-N-T camp member. A Steven R. Majewski is W.H. Vanderbilt Professor of Astronomy at the University of Virginia and Principal Investigator of the APOGEE galactic survey, but this identity as the T-N-T camp member is unconfirmed.

name: Massey, Walter E.
employer: University of Chicago; School of the Art Institute of Chicago (emeritus)
title: Senior Advisor to the President; President Emeritus
ngos: Andrew W. Mellon Foundation (former trustee); Commonwealth Fund (former); MacArthur Foundation (former); RAND Corporation (former director); Smithsonian Institution (former); Giant Magellan Telescope Organization (Chairman emeritus / special advisor); City Colleges of Chicago (Chairman, Board of Trustees); American Association for the Advancement of Science (former president, 1989); National Academy of Sciences (member)
notes: Walter Eugene Massey (born April 5, 1938, Hattiesburg, Mississippi) is an American physicist and educator. He received his PhD from Washington University. Career highlights: Director of Argonne National Laboratory (1979-1991); Director of the National Science Foundation under President George H.W. Bush (1990-1993), where he helped secure Congressional funding for LIGO; Provost and Vice President for Academic Affairs, University of California system (1993-1995); President of Morehouse College (1995-2007); President of the School of the Art Institute of Chicago (2010-2016). He was the first African American president of the AAAS. Corporate board service includes: Bank of America (director and Chairman, 2009); BP PLC; Delta Air Lines; McDonald's Corporation; Motorola. He has received 41 honorary degrees. Published 'In the Eye of the Storm: My Time as Chairman of Bank of America' (2018).

name: McKennon, Marc Jon
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Marc Jon McKennon as a Bohemian Grove T-N-T camp member. A Marc McKennon is listed as a former Director of Technical Development at CTI BioPharma (pharmaceutical company in Seattle) and President at Sound Cmc Consulting, but identity as the T-N-T camp member is unconfirmed.

name: McReynolds, Thomas P.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Thomas P. McReynolds as a Bohemian Grove T-N-T camp member. Multiple individuals named Thomas McReynolds exist in California, including one associated with Los Altos Hills and Santa Clara University with investment banking background, but identity cannot be confirmed.

name: Moore, Mark Alexander
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Mark Alexander Moore as a Bohemian Grove T-N-T camp member. A Mark A. Moore received the California Lawyers Association Business Law Section's 2021 Lifetime Achievement Award for contributions to California business law, particularly consumer financial services and fintech, but identity as this camp member is unconfirmed.

name: Morley, H. Barclay
title: Chairman of the Board and CEO (retired)
notes: Henry Barclay Morley (born April 25, 1929, Sydney, Nova Scotia, Canada) earned a BS from St. Francis Xavier University (1948) and a PhD from the University of Toronto (1953). He immigrated to the United States in 1953 and was naturalized in 1962. Career at Stauffer Chemical Company: Director of Eastern Research Center (1962-1967); assistant to president (1967-1968); VP Technical (1968-1970); Executive VP (1970-1972); President (1972-1974); President and CEO in Westport, CT (1974); Chairman of the Board (from 1977). He served as director of Bank of New York, Champion International, and Schering-Plough. Received the Chemical Industry Medal in 1982. Stauffer Chemical was acquired by ICI in 1987.

name: Nelson, Ward T.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Ward T. Nelson as a Bohemian Grove T-N-T camp member. A Ward Nelson works as a Senior Principal Manager in Quality Assurance at Genentech in San Francisco, but identity as this camp member is unconfirmed.

name: Pottruck, David
title: Chairman and CEO (Red Eagle Ventures); Executive Chairman (Grovara)
ngos: HighTower Advisors (Chairman); Intel Corporation (former director, 1998-2018); Wharton School Center for Leadership and Change Management (Senior Fellow and adjunct faculty)
notes: David S. Pottruck graduated from the University of Pennsylvania (1970) and Wharton School (MBA, 1972). Joined Charles Schwab Corporation in 1984 as EVP of Marketing; became President (1992), co-CEO with Charles Schwab (1998-2003), and sole CEO (2003-2004) before being dismissed by the board in July 2004. Subsequently: founder/Chairman/CEO of Red Eagle Ventures, Inc. (private equity, San Francisco, since 2005); helped launch HighTower Advisors, a wealth management firm (2008). Board director of Intel Corporation (1998-2018). Named Executive Chairman of Grovara (food and beverage export marketplace) in 2025. Author of 'Stacking the Deck' (2014) and 'Clicks and Mortar' (2000). Received the 2020 Joseph Wharton Lifetime Achievement Award from the Wharton Club of New York.

name: Reynoso, Raul
notes: No reliable public biographical information found for a Raul Reynoso specifically connected to Bohemian Grove or the T-N-T camp. This should not be confused with Justice Cruz Reynoso (1931-2021), the first Latino Associate Justice of the California Supreme Court, whose first name is Cruz, not Raul. No independent record of a Raul Reynoso in a prominent California professional or judicial capacity was identified.

name: Riley, Benjamin K.
title: Partner
ngos: American Bar Foundation (Fellow); Litigation Counsel of America (Senior Fellow); Association of Business Trial Lawyers, Northern California Chapter (former president)
notes: Benjamin K. Riley is a Partner at Bartko Pavia LLP in San Francisco with over 40 years of legal experience. He graduated from Dartmouth College (BA in Religion, 1979) and UC Berkeley School of Law (JD, 1983), where he was an Associate Editor of the California Law Review. His practice focuses on intellectual property litigation (patents, trade secrets, copyrights, trademarks) and complex business litigation. Selected by the California Daily Journal as one of the 'Top 100 Lawyers in California' (2023). Ranked by Chambers since 2019 as a top California attorney in Intellectual Property Litigation: Trademark, Copyright & Trade Secrets.

name: Sanford, Jeff
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Jeff Sanford as a T-N-T camp Bohemian Grove member. Multiple individuals named Jeff/Jeffrey Sanford exist, including a Managing Director in Ares Real Estate in California, but none confirmed as this specific camp member.

name: Scully, John H.
employer: SPO Advisory Corp (successor to SPO Partners & Co.)
title: Co-Founder and Managing Director
political_donations: Democrat. Donated to Gavin Newsom (2022), Obama campaign, Wisconsin Democratic Party, Kirsten Gillibrand, and other Democrats (2012). Gave $200,000 to charter school supporter Marshall Tuck (2014).
ngos: Making Waves Education Foundation, Richmond CA (founder and chairman, since 1989); Stanford University (former trustee and vice chairman, Board of Trustees; former chair, finance committee); Stanford Hospital and Clinics (vice chairman); Princeton University (former trustee; former chair, finance committee); Success Academy Charter Schools (emeritus board member); San Francisco Giants (minority owner, since 2000); Horatio Alger Association (member)
notes: John H. Scully (born 1944, New York City) holds a BA from Princeton University (Woodrow Wilson School of Public and International Affairs, 1966) and an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business (1968). He co-founded SPO Partners & Co. in 1991, a San Francisco-based private investment firm that managed approximately $5 billion at its peak before closing in 2018 (succeeded by SPO Advisory Corp). Previously was a founding general partner of Texas Partners (Bass family investment entity, 1971-1991). SPO's portfolio concentrated on timberland, wood products, telecom, media, and real estate. He is the largest capital partner in San Francisco's Pier 39. Received the Ernest C. Arbuckle Award from Stanford GSB.

name: Sertich, John L.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying John L. Sertich as a Bohemian Grove T-N-T camp member. Multiple individuals with this name exist in different industries.

name: Smith, Bruce C.
title: President
ngos: California Homebuilding Foundation; National Association of Home Builders (former president, 2001); California Building Industry Association (former president, 1994); BIA of Northern California (former president, 1986)
notes: Bruce C. Smith is President of Smith Quality Homes, a Walnut Creek, California-based family homebuilding and land development company with over 65 years of history. A fourth-generation Californian and second-generation custom homebuilder, he holds a BS from Menlo College in Menlo Park and an MBA with honors from UC Berkeley. He served as President of the National Association of Home Builders (NAHB) in 2001 and as President of the California Building Industry Association in 1994.

name: Stanford, Alan G.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Alan G. Stanford as a Bohemian Grove T-N-T camp member. Not to be confused with convicted fraudster R. Allen Stanford (no relation).

name: Stephens, Justin Hunnicutt
employer: Stephens Family Wines, LLC; Hunnicutt Wine Company, LLC
title: Managing Partner; Founder
notes: Justin Hunnicutt Stephens graduated from UC Berkeley (BA, 1998). He founded HUNNICUTT Wines in Napa Valley in 2001 and began working for D.R. Stephens Estate (his father Don R. Stephens's winery, founded 1996) in 2004. In 2007, he and his father created Stephens Family Wines, LLC, which now owns both wine brands. In 2008 he formed Hunnicutt Wine Company, LLC, completing a custom crush winery in St. Helena in 2011 that makes wine for approximately 20 other small Napa Valley brands.

name: Tevis, Michael L.
title: President
ngos: ArtFusion.io (Executive Director, 501(c)(3) nonprofit focused on preservation of space for arts, makers, and small business)
notes: Michael L. Tevis is President of Intrinsic Ventures, Inc., a real estate development firm based in Menlo Park, California (530 Oak Grove Ave, Suite 201). He holds a BA in Economics from Stanford University (1983). Since 1995, through Intrinsic Ventures and its affiliates, he has acquired and developed approximately 1,200,000 square feet of office, retail, industrial, and rental residential space across more than 50 projects in the Western US, primarily the Bay Area and Portland, Oregon. His current focus is urban infill transit locations.

name: Tilden, Calvin B.
notes: No reliable public biographical information found uniquely identifying Calvin B. Tilden as a Bohemian Grove T-N-T camp member.

name: Veach, Jay
title: President and Owner
notes: Jay 'Kelly' Veach is the President and Owner of Boat & Motor Mart, Inc., located at 401 Marina Blvd., Burlingame, California. He grew up in San Francisco and worked summers at Diamond R stables in Northern California. He is also a musician and songwriter; his song 'No Hyphen in American' has been performed before military and political audiences.
